snippet: In the current fiscal talks, Republicans are pushing for significant changes to Medicare, while Democrats are arguing that it is not the most pressing budget problem.
abstract: In the current fiscal talks, Republicans are pushing for significant changes to Medicare, while Democrats are arguing that it is not the most pressing budget problem.
lead_paragraph: The projected growth of Medicare costs is the single biggest contributor to the country’s long-term budget deficits, many estimates show. No cohort of Americans, with the possible exception of the very affluent, pays enough in Medicare taxes and premiums to cover its eventual Medicare costs.

headline.main: Foreseeing the Issues in Medicare’s Future
